chargeHist.descr: Operator Flee/Elude Officer-Bodily Harm or Property Damage

result.execSummary:
The defendant Darius Dywone Berry was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • 1st-Degree Recklessly Endangering Safety, a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 941.30(1).
  • Operator Flee/Elude Officer-Bodily Harm or Property Damage, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.04(3).
  • Battery [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse Assessments], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).
  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse Assessments], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).
  • Bail Jumping-Misdemeanor [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse Assessments], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(a).
  • Bail Jumping-Misdemeanor [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse Assessments], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Darius Dywone Berry

records.addlTxt: Filed: Original Transcript of Guilty Plea & Sentencing ( 53 pages) commencing 10-27-2022 by Debra A. Wisniewski.

Defendant Darius Dywone Berry in court, in custody.  Attorney John Mathew Krejci in court for Darius Dywone Berry.  Attorney Michelle A. Grasso in court for State of Wisconsin. 
AS TO COUNTS 1, 2, 4, 6, 7, and 8:
Defendant changes plea to GUILTY. Defendant examined as to his plea, advised of his Constitutional rights and the maximum penalty. Court found that defendant freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived his rights. Plea questionnaire received and filed. Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea. Court found defendant guilty as charged in the information and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record. Defendant is advised he/she is a convicted felon and may not possess any firearms. Defendant is advised he/she is unable to vote in any election until civil rights are restored. Defendant further advised that if he/she is not a US citizen deportation is possible.  

AS TO COUNTS: 3, 5, 9 and 10: Per plea negotiations and on the State's motion, Court ordered dismissed and read in.

Sentencing proceeds. Statements made by the State, defense and defendant. 
AS TO COUNT 1: 
The Court sentenced defendant to serve a term of IMPRISONMENT in the Wisconsin State Prisons for 6 YEARS concurrent to Counts 2, 4, 6, 7 and consecutive to 21CM3103, 22CM258, 22CM1431 .  INITIAL CONFINEMENT of 3 YEAR  and EXTENDED SUPERVISION of 3 YEARS.

AS TO COUNT 2: 
The Court sentenced defendant to serve a term of IMPRISONMENT in the Wisconsin State Prisons for 6 YEARS concurrent to Counts 1, 4, 6, 7 and consecutive to 21CM3103, 22CM258, 22CM1431.  INITIAL CONFINEMENT of 3 YEAR  and EXTENDED SUPERVISION of 3 YEARS.

AS TO COUNT 4: 
The Court sentenced defendant to serve 9 months at the House of Correction, concurrent to Counts 1, 2, 6, and 7 and consecutive to 21CM3103, 22CM258, 22CM1431.

AS TO COUNT 6:
The Court sentenced defendant to serve 3 months at the House of Correction, concurrent to Counts 1, 2, 4 and 7 and consecutive to 21CM3103, 22CM258, 22CM1431.

AS TO COUNT 7:
The Court sentenced defendant to serve 6 months at the House of Correction, concurrent to Counts 1, 2, 4 and 6  and consecutive to 21CM3103, 22CM258, 22CM1431.

AS TO COUNT 8: 
The Court sentenced defendant to serve 169 days at the House of Correction with 169 days time served.  Time served disposition 
Defendant is provide DNA sample and pay DNA surcharge by 10-27-2023; failure to pay shall result in a civil judgment being entered.
Defendant is to pay all mandatory court costs, fees and surcharges by 10-27-22; failure to pay shall result in a civil judgment being entered.
Court waived all non mandatory court costs fees and surcharges finding the defendant indigent.


CONDITIONS OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION:
-provide DNA sample and pay DNA surcharge during extended supervision; failure to pay shall result in a civil judgment being entered;
-pay all mandatory court costs, fees and surcharges during extended supervision; failure to pay shall result in a civil judgment being entered;
-Court waived all non-mandatory court costs, fees and surcharges finding the defendant indigent.
-obtain his GED;
-No contact with J.L.S and Z.J.M.

Defendant is informed he may not possess and firearms or body armor.
Defendant is informed he may not vote in any election until his civil rights have been reinstated.

Defendant is not eligible for Challenge Incarceration Program.
Defendant is not eligible for the Wisconsin Substance Abuse Program.

Appeal rights given. Written Explanation of Determinate Sentence and Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief received and filed. Copies given to defendant. -- gmb

Defendant Darius Dywone Berry not in court, in custody.  Attorney John Mathew Krejci appeared by video for Darius Dywone Berry.  Prosecuting attorney Michelle A. Grasso in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Attorney Krejci appears by video unable to appear in person.  Case is adjourned to 10-27-22 at 8:30 for plea and sentencing.
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for October 27, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Darius Dywone Berry not in court, in custody.  Attorney John Mathew Krejci in court for Darius Dywone Berry.  Prosecuting attorney Michelle A. Grasso in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Final pretrial proceeded.  State's offer stated on the record.  Defense rejects State's offer.  Case remains in jury trial posture.  Case is adjourned to 10-26-22 at 8;30 am for Jury Trial.
Received and Filed. STATES MOTION FOR JOINDER

Defendant Darius Dywone Berry not in court, in custody.  Attorney John Mathew Krejci in court for Darius Dywone Berry.  Prosecuting attorney Michelle A. Grasso in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Defendant has a new case that needs an initial appearance that Attorney Krejci has not been appoint in yet. (22CM1431). Parties are requesting an adjourned final pretrial.  Case is adjourned to 10-3-22 at 8:30 am for final pretrial in person in room 504 of the Courthouse.
Final pre-trial scheduled for October 3, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Final pre-trial scheduled for October 3, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Attorney John Mathew Krejci in court, defendant Darius Dywone Berry not in court, in custody.  Jacob A. Maule appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
 Defense is requesting final pretrial and jury trial dates. Case is adjourned to 9-14-22 at 8:30 am for final pretrial and 10-26-22 t 8:30 am for jury trial.  Final pre-trial scheduled for September 14, 2022 at 08:30 am.  Jury trial scheduled for October 26, 2022 at 08:30 am.

CASE HEARD IN PRELIM FOR BR 10:
Defendant Darius Dywone Berry in court with Attorney John Mathew Krejci; both appear by video.  Defendant Darius Dywone Berry in custody.  Edward OBrien appeared in person for the State of Wisconsin.  
Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the State:    State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and plead not guilty.  Case is adjourned to Branch 10.  Scheduling conference scheduled for July 27, 2022 at 08:30 am.

CASE HEARD IN PRELIM FOR BR. 10
Attorney John Krejci in court, appear by video.  Adam Joseph Best appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin.  
Case set for a preliminary hearing. State witness present. Due to court congestion, Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for a Preliminary Hearing in Preliminary Hearing Court, Room 146 of the Criminal Justice Facility.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for July 7, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with JC and Z J-M.

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for Level 5 Supervision.  
No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

Defendant Darius Dywone Berry in court with attorney John Mathew Krejci who appeared as a friend of the Court.  Ryan Jay Michaels appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Darius Dywone Berry appeared by video means with Attorney.  Deputy Court Clerk: SD.
Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Havas, Branch 10.
Defendant given a copy of complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT DOES QUALIFY FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.  Attorney Krejci will contact the public defenders office regarding appointment of counsel.  Case is adjourned for preliminary hearing in Branch PE.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for June 9, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Darius Dywone Berry in court with attorney John Mathew Krejci on defendant's other cases.  Court will schedule this case for an initial appearance with defendant's other case.  Case scheduled for Initial Appearance on 5/31/2022 at 8:30 am, Courthouse Room 504.
